canonical_explanation.text: A magnet is an object that attracts materials like iron, nickel, and cobalt. Magnets have two poles - north pole and south pole - where the magnetic force is strongest. Like poles (north-north or south-south) repel each other, while unlike poles (north-south) attract each other. Materials attracted by magnets are called magnetic materials (iron, cobalt, nickel, steel). Materials not attracted by magnets are called non-magnetic materials (wood, plastic, copper, aluminum). Magnets are used in many everyday devices like compasses, refrigerator doors, and speakers.
rules: Magnets attract iron, nickel, and cobalt.
Every magnet has two poles: north and south.
Magnetic force is strongest at the poles.
A freely suspended magnet points in the north-south direction.
Magnetic materials: iron, nickel, cobalt, steel.
Non-magnetic materials: wood, plastic, copper, aluminum, glass.
Artificial magnets: bar magnet, horseshoe magnet, cylindrical magnet.

questions.question_text: A magnet attracts:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C because iron, nickel, and cobalt are the only materials that are strongly attracted to magnets. These materials are called magnetic materials. Other metals and materials are not attracted to magnets.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers are not correct because magnets do not attract all metals (A) or all materials (B). Magnets only attract certain magnetic materials like iron, nickel, and cobalt (C). Magnets do not attract just iron alone (D), they attract a few specific magnetic materials.

questions.question_text: How many poles does a magnet have?
questions.explanation_correct: A magnet has two poles - a north pole and a south pole. This is because the magnetic force in a magnet is strongest at the two ends, or poles, of the magnet. So the correct answer is that a magnet has two poles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A magnet does not have just one pole or three/four poles. Magnets always have two poles - a north pole and a south pole. This is a fundamental property of magnets. The other options like one, three, or four poles are incorrect because they do not match the actual number of poles that a magnet has.

questions.question_text: The poles of a magnet are called:
questions.explanation_correct: The poles of a magnet are called the north pole and the south pole. This is because magnets have a special magnetic force that pulls other magnetic materials towards them, and this force is strongest at the two ends or poles of the magnet.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The poles of a magnet are not called east and west, up and down, or positive and negative. These are not the correct names for the two ends or poles of a magnet. The correct names for the poles of a magnet are the north pole and the south pole, as these are the places where the magnetic force is strongest.

questions.question_text: What happens when two north poles of magnets are brought close together?
questions.explanation_correct: When two north poles of magnets are brought close together, they repel each other. This is because magnets have a magnetic field, and the north poles of two magnets have the same type of magnetic field, which causes them to push away from each other.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is that the two north poles will repel each other. This is because the north poles of magnets have the same type of magnetic field, which means they will push away from each other. The other options, such as attracting or sticking together, are incorrect because they describe what happens when a north and a south pole are brought together, not two north poles.

questions.question_text: What happens when a north pole and south pole of two magnets are brought close together?
questions.explanation_correct: When a north pole and a south pole of two magnets are brought close together, they will attract each other. This is because opposite magnetic poles (north and south) are attracted to each other, while like poles (north-north or south-south) repel each other.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because they do not describe what happens when a north pole and a south pole are brought close together. Option A (they repel) is incorrect because opposite poles actually attract each other. Option C (nothing happens) is incorrect because the north and south poles will definitely interact and attract. Option D (they break) is incorrect because the magnets will not break when their opposite poles are brought close together.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a magnetic material?
questions.explanation_correct: Iron is a magnetic material. This means that iron is attracted to magnets. Magnets can pick up and hold iron objects because iron contains magnetic properties.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wood, plastic, and rubber are not magnetic materials. They do not get attracted to magnets. This is because these materials do not have the special magnetic properties that materials like iron, nickel, and cobalt have. Only magnetic materials can be picked up by magnets.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a non-magnetic material?
questions.explanation_correct: Copper is a non-magnetic material, which means it is not attracted to magnets. This is because copper does not contain the magnetic materials like iron, cobalt, or nickel that are needed for a material to be magnetic.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Iron, cobalt, and nickel are magnetic materials that are attracted to magnets. This is because they contain atoms with unpaired electrons that create a magnetic field. Copper, on the other hand, is a non-magnetic material that is not attracted to magnets. This is because the atoms in copper do not have unpaired electrons that can create a magnetic field.

questions.question_text: A natural magnet is called:
questions.explanation_correct: A natural magnet is called a lodestone, which is a type of iron ore that has natural magnetic properties. Lodestones were one of the earliest known natural magnets, and were used in early compasses to find the Earth's magnetic north.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not the correct answer for a natural magnet. A bar magnet and a horseshoe magnet are both artificial magnets that are made by humans. A cylindrical magnet is also an artificial type of magnet, not a natural one like a lodestone.

questions.question_text: The magnetic force is strongest at the:
questions.explanation_correct: The magnetic force is strongest at the poles of a magnet because that's where the magnetic field is the most concentrated. The north and south poles are the points where the magnetic field is the strongest.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The magnetic force is not strongest at the middle, sides, or all parts equally. This is because the magnetic field is not uniform throughout the magnet. It is the strongest at the north and south poles, where the magnetic field is most concentrated.

questions.question_text: Which type of artificial magnet is shaped like a bar?
questions.explanation_correct: A bar magnet is a type of artificial magnet that is shaped like a long, straight bar. This is the correct answer because bar magnets are one of the most common types of artificial magnets used in everyday devices.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not the correct shape for a bar magnet. A horseshoe magnet is U-shaped, a cylindrical magnet is round like a cylinder, and a ring magnet is circular. Only the bar magnet has the long, straight bar shape described in the question.

questions.question_text: A compass uses a magnet to show:
questions.explanation_correct: A compass uses a magnet to show the direction because the magnet inside the compass aligns itself with the Earth's magnetic field, pointing to the north direction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A compass does not show time, speed, or temperature. It shows the direction because the magnet inside it is attracted to the Earth's magnetic north pole, allowing the compass to point north and show the direction.

questions.question_text: When a bar magnet is freely suspended, its north pole points towards:
questions.explanation_correct: The north pole of a bar magnet points towards the geographic north because the Earth itself acts as a huge magnet, with its north and south magnetic poles. The north pole of a bar magnet is attracted to the Earth's south magnetic pole, which is located close to the geographic north.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The north pole of a bar magnet does not point towards the geographic south, east, or west. This is because the Earth's magnetic field causes the north pole of a bar magnet to align itself with the Earth's south magnetic pole, which is located close to the geographic north. The bar magnet's north pole will always point towards the Earth's north magnetic pole, which is near the geographic north.

questions.question_text: Steel is a:
questions.explanation_correct: Steel is a magnetic material because it contains iron, which is a magnetic metal. Magnets are made of materials like iron, cobalt, and nickel that can be attracted to a magnetic field.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Steel is a magnetic material, not a non-magnetic material. This is because steel contains iron, which is a metal that can be attracted to magnets. Materials like wood, plastic, and aluminum are non-magnetic because they do not contain magnetic metals like iron, cobalt, or nickel.

questions.question_text: A magnet can be used to separate iron filings from a mixture of sand and iron filings because:

options.text: Iron is attracted by the magnet
Sand is attracted by the magnet

questions.explanation_correct: Iron is attracted by the magnet, while sand is not. This means the magnet can pick up and separate the iron filings from the sand mixture.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sand is not attracted to the magnet, so it will not be picked up. Iron, on the other hand, is a magnetic material and will be attracted to the magnet, allowing it to be separated from the sand. The magnet does not make the iron float on the sand - it simply pulls the iron filings towards itself.

questions.question_text: Aluminum is not attracted by a magnet. This means aluminum is:
questions.explanation_correct: Aluminum is not attracted by a magnet, which means it is a non-magnetic material. Non-magnetic materials are not affected by the magnetic force from a magnet.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Aluminum is not a magnetic material, so it is not attracted to a magnet. Magnetic materials like iron, cobalt, and nickel are attracted to magnets, but aluminum is a non-magnetic material that does not respond to the magnetic force. This is why aluminum is classified as a non-magnetic material.

questions.question_text: Refrigerator doors stay closed because of:
questions.explanation_correct: Refrigerator doors stay closed because of the magnetic strip on the door. This magnetic strip attracts the metal frame of the refrigerator, keeping the door tightly shut.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The refrigerator door does not stay closed because of a lock, gravity, or a spring. These things may help keep the door closed, but the main reason is the magnetic strip. The magnetic strip on the door creates a strong attraction to the metal frame of the refrigerator, allowing the door to stay shut tightly.

questions.question_text: If you break a bar magnet in half, you get:

options.text: One north pole and one south pole
Two magnets, each with north and south poles

questions.explanation_correct: If you break a bar magnet in half, you get two separate magnets, each with its own north and south poles. This is because the magnetic force is present throughout the magnet, so when you divide it, each piece becomes a complete magnet.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Breaking a bar magnet does not result in just a north pole or just a south pole. Each piece of the broken magnet will have both a north and a south pole, so the correct answer is that you get two magnets, each with north and south poles.

questions.question_text: To pick up scattered iron pins, you would use:
questions.explanation_correct: A magnet is the best tool to pick up scattered iron pins because magnets are attracted to magnetic materials like iron. The magnetic force of a magnet can pull the iron pins towards it, allowing you to easily collect them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A glass rod, wooden stick, or plastic ruler are not magnetic materials, so they cannot be used to pick up scattered iron pins. Iron pins are attracted to magnets, so using a magnet is the correct way to collect them.

questions.question_text: A magnet will NOT attract:
questions.explanation_correct: A wooden pencil is not made of a magnetic material, so a magnet will not attract it. Magnets only attract objects made of iron, nickel, or cobalt.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A magnet will attract steel, iron, and nickel because these are magnetic materials. However, wood is not magnetic, so a magnet will not attract a wooden pencil. The correct answer is that a magnet will not attract a wooden pencil.

questions.question_text: Two magnets are placed on a table. If they move toward each other on their own, their facing poles are:
questions.explanation_correct: When two magnets are placed on a table and they move towards each other on their own, it means that their facing poles are unlike poles (north-south or south-north). Unlike poles attract each other, causing the magnets to move towards each other.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because: Option A (same poles) is wrong, as like poles (north-north or south-south) repel each other, not attract. Option C (no poles) is wrong, as all magnets have north and south poles. Option D (cannot determine) is wrong, as we can clearly see the magnets are moving towards each other, indicating their facing poles are unlike.

questions.question_text: Credit cards have a magnetic strip that stores:
questions.explanation_correct: The magnetic strip on a credit card stores information, such as the card number, expiration date, and security code. This information is used to identify the card and make purchases.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The magnetic strip on a credit card does not store pictures, money, or electricity. It is used to store digital information, such as your card details, that can be read by card readers. This allows the card to be used for making payments and transactions.

questions.question_text: Which property of magnets is used in making a compass?

options.text: A freely suspended magnet points north-south

questions.explanation_correct: A compass uses the property of magnets that a freely suspended magnet will always point towards the north-south direction. This is because the Earth itself acts as a giant magnet, and the compass needle aligns with the Earth's magnetic field.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Magnets being strong or attracting iron are not the properties used in a compass. The property used is that a freely suspended magnet will always point north-south, which helps the compass determine direction. The other options are not the key property used in a compass.

questions.question_text: The statement 'like poles repel and unlike poles attract' is called:
questions.explanation_correct: The statement 'like poles repel and unlike poles attract' is called the 'magnetic law of poles'. This is a fundamental principle of magnetism that describes how the north and south poles of magnets interact with each other.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The 'law of attraction' is not the correct name for this principle. The law of attraction is a different concept that describes how objects are drawn towards each other. The 'magnetic law of poles' is the specific term used to describe the attraction and repulsion between the north and south poles of magnets.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a magnetic material?
questions.explanation_correct: Gold is not a magnetic material. Magnetic materials are those that are attracted to magnets, like iron, cobalt, and nickel. Gold is a non-magnetic material that is not attracted to magnets.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Iron, cobalt, and nickel are all magnetic materials that are attracted to magnets. These metals have a property called ferromagnetism, which allows them to be magnetized. However, gold is a non-magnetic material that is not attracted to magnets. It does not have the same ferromagnetic properties as the other options.

questions.question_text: In an electric bell, magnets are used to:
questions.explanation_correct: In an electric bell, magnets are used to make the hammer move. The magnets create a magnetic field that pulls the hammer towards the bell, causing it to strike and make a sound.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options do not correctly describe the role of magnets in an electric bell. Magnets are not used to produce electricity, make the sound louder, or keep the bell cool. The magnets are used to create a magnetic field that moves the hammer to strike the bell and produce the ringing sound.

questions.question_text: Which shape of magnet is called a U-shaped magnet?
questions.explanation_correct: The shape of a magnet that is called a U-shaped magnet is the horseshoe magnet. This is because the horseshoe magnet has a U-shaped bend, with the north and south poles at the two ends of the 'U'.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The bar magnet is a straight, rectangular-shaped magnet. The cylindrical magnet is a round, tube-shaped magnet. The ring magnet is a circular magnet with a hole in the middle. None of these shapes are called a U-shaped magnet. The horseshoe magnet, with its curved 'U' shape, is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: A scientist wants to test if a material is magnetic. The best way is to:

options.text: See if it floats in water
Bring a magnet near it and observe

questions.explanation_correct: The best way to test if a material is magnetic is to bring a magnet near it and observe if it is attracted to the magnet. This is because magnetic materials like iron, nickel, and cobalt are the only ones that will be attracted to a magnet.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Floating in water, heating the material, or measuring its weight are not good ways to test if a material is magnetic. These methods do not directly show whether the material is attracted to a magnet or not. The correct way is to simply bring a magnet close to the material and see if it gets pulled towards the magnet.

questions.question_text: Two south poles of magnets brought together will:
questions.explanation_correct: Two south poles of magnets will repel each other because like poles (north-north or south-south) always repel. This is because the magnetic fields around the two south poles are pointing in the same direction, pushing the magnets apart.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The two south poles of magnets will not attract each other. Magnets have a north pole and a south pole, and opposite poles (north-south) attract while like poles (north-north or south-south) repel. So two south poles will push each other away, not stick together.

questions.question_text: Magnets should be stored with their opposite poles together because:

options.text: It prevents them from losing magnetic strength

questions.explanation_correct: Magnets should be stored with their opposite poles together because it prevents them from losing their magnetic strength. This is because when opposite poles are facing each other, the magnetic fields strengthen and maintain the magnet's power.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not the correct reasons for storing magnets with their opposite poles together. Option A is incorrect because the appearance of the magnets does not matter for their function. Option C is incorrect because storing magnets this way does not make them lighter. Option D is incorrect because it does not make the magnets bigger either. The correct reason is that it prevents the magnets from losing their magnetic strength over time.

questions.question_text: The region around a magnet where its magnetic force can be experienced is called:
questions.explanation_correct: The region around a magnet where its magnetic force can be experienced is called the magnetic field. This is the area where the magnet's invisible magnetic force is strong enough to attract or repel other magnetic objects.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'magnetic field'. The region around a magnet where its magnetic force is experienced is not called a 'magnetic zone', 'magnetic area', or 'magnetic space'. These are not the correct scientific terms for describing the area around a magnet where its magnetic force can be felt.

questions.question_text: Magnets attract all metals.
questions.explanation_correct: The statement 'Magnets attract all metals' is false. Magnets only attract certain metals like iron, nickel, and cobalt, which are called magnetic materials. Other metals like aluminum, copper, and wood are not attracted to magnets, as they are non-magnetic materials.
questions.explanation_incorrect: It is a common misconception that magnets attract all metals. However, this is not true. Magnets only attract certain metals like iron, nickel, and cobalt, which are called magnetic materials. Other metals like aluminum, copper, and wood are not attracted to magnets, as they are non-magnetic materials. Therefore, the statement 'Magnets attract all metals' is false.

questions.question_text: Like poles of magnets attract each other.
questions.explanation_correct: The statement 'Like poles of magnets attract each other' is false. Magnets have two poles - north and south. Like poles (north-north or south-south) actually repel each other, while unlike poles (north-south) attract each other.
questions.explanation_incorrect: It is a common misconception that like poles of magnets attract each other. However, this is not correct. Like poles (north-north or south-south) actually push away or repel each other. Only unlike poles (north-south) are attracted to each other.

questions.question_text: Unlike poles of magnets attract each other.
questions.explanation_correct: The statement 'Unlike poles of magnets attract each other' is true. This is because magnets have a north pole and a south pole, and the opposite poles (north-south) are attracted to each other, while the same poles (north-north or south-south) repel each other.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer would be to say that 'like poles of magnets attract each other'. This is not true because magnets have a north pole and a south pole, and the opposite poles (north-south) are attracted to each other, while the same poles (north-north or south-south) repel each other.

questions.question_text: Copper is attracted by a magnet.
questions.explanation_correct: Copper is a non-magnetic material, which means it is not attracted to magnets. Magnets only attract materials like iron, nickel, and cobalt, which are magnetic materials.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement 'Copper is attracted by a magnet' is false. Copper is a non-magnetic material, which means it does not get attracted to magnets. Only magnetic materials like iron, nickel, and cobalt are attracted to magnets. Copper is not one of these magnetic materials, so it will not be pulled towards a magnet.

questions.question_text: A magnet can attract iron even through a thin sheet of paper.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, a magnet can attract iron even through a thin sheet of paper. This is because the magnetic force from the magnet is strong enough to pass through the paper and attract the iron. The magnetic force from a magnet can travel through many non-magnetic materials like paper, wood, or plastic.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No, a magnet cannot attract iron through a thin sheet of paper. This is because paper is a non-magnetic material that blocks the magnetic force. The magnetic force from the magnet is not strong enough to pass through the paper and attract the iron. Only magnetic materials like iron, nickel, and cobalt can be attracted by a magnet, not non-magnetic materials like paper.

questions.question_text: When a magnet is broken into pieces, each piece becomes a complete magnet with both poles.
questions.explanation_correct: When a magnet is broken into pieces, each piece becomes a complete magnet with both north and south poles. This is because the magnetic domains (tiny magnets) inside the magnet are aligned in a way that each piece has its own north and south poles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: It is a common misconception that when a magnet is broken, each piece will not have both poles. However, this is not the case. Even if a magnet is broken into many small pieces, each piece will still have a north pole and a south pole. This is because the magnetic domains inside the magnet are aligned in a specific way, and each piece retains this alignment.

questions.question_text: A compass needle is a small magnet.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, a compass needle is a small magnet. Compasses use a small magnetized needle that aligns itself with the Earth's magnetic field, pointing towards the north and south poles. This allows the compass to indicate direction, making it a useful tool for navigation.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A compass needle is not just a normal object, it is a small magnet. The needle is made of a magnetic material that can align itself with the Earth's magnetic field. This is why a compass can be used to find the direction, as the needle points towards the north and south poles.

questions.question_text: Lodestone is a natural magnet found in nature.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, the statement is true. Lodestone is a naturally occurring magnetic iron ore, which means it is a natural magnet found in nature. Lodestones have the ability to attract iron and other magnetic materials.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Lodestone is a natural magnet, so the statement is true. Some people may think that only artificial magnets made in factories are considered 'real' magnets, but natural magnets like lodestone also exist in nature and have the same magnetic properties as manufactured magnets.

questions.question_text: Glass is a magnetic material.
questions.explanation_correct: Glass is not a magnetic material. Magnets only attract certain metals like iron, nickel, and cobalt, not non-metallic materials like glass.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Glass is a non-magnetic material, meaning it is not attracted to magnets. This is because glass is made of a combination of non-metallic elements like silicon, oxygen, and other chemicals, which do not respond to the magnetic force. Only certain metals like iron, nickel, and cobalt can be attracted to magnets.

questions.question_text: The magnetic force is weakest at the poles of a magnet.
questions.explanation_correct: The magnetic force is actually strongest at the poles of a magnet. This is because the magnetic field is concentrated at the poles, creating a stronger pull or attraction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The magnetic force is not weakest at the poles of a magnet. In fact, the opposite is true - the magnetic force is strongest at the poles. This is because the magnetic field is concentrated and most intense at the poles, creating a stronger pull or attraction compared to other parts of the magnet.

questions.question_text: A magnet has two poles: ___ and south.
questions.explanation_correct: A magnet has two poles - a north pole and a south pole. The north pole and south pole are the two ends of the magnet where the magnetic force is strongest. So the missing word in the sentence is 'north'.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'north'. A magnet has two poles - a north pole and a south pole. The north pole is one of the two poles of a magnet. The other pole is the south pole. So the full sentence should be 'A magnet has two poles: north and south.'

questions.question_text: Like poles ___ each other.
questions.explanation_correct: Like poles repel each other because magnets have a north and a south pole. The north pole of one magnet is attracted to the south pole of another magnet, but two north poles or two south poles will push away from each other. This is the law of magnetic attraction and repulsion.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'repel'. Like poles, such as two north poles or two south poles, will push away from each other. This is because magnets have a north and a south pole, and opposites attract while likes repel. The incorrect answer would be 'attract', which is what happens when you bring the north and south poles of two magnets together.

questions.question_text: Unlike poles ___ each other.
questions.explanation_correct: Unlike poles (north-south) attract each other because the magnetic forces between them are in the same direction, pulling them together. This is why opposite poles of two magnets stick together.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The question asks about unlike poles, which means the north pole of one magnet and the south pole of another magnet. The accepted answer is 'attract'. Unlike poles attract each other because the magnetic forces between them point in the same direction, pulling the poles together. This is the opposite of like poles (north-north or south-south) which repel each other.

questions.question_text: Iron, nickel, and cobalt are examples of ___ materials.
questions.explanation_correct: Iron, nickel, and cobalt are examples of magnetic materials because they are attracted to magnets. These materials contain tiny magnetic particles that line up when near a magnet, causing the material to be pulled towards the magnet.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'magnetic'. Iron, nickel, and cobalt are magnetic materials because they can be attracted by magnets. Materials that are not attracted to magnets, such as wood, plastic, copper, and aluminum, are called non-magnetic materials. Magnetic materials are special because they have small magnetic particles that can be aligned by a magnet, making the entire material magnetic.

questions.question_text: Wood, plastic, and rubber are examples of ___ materials.
questions.explanation_correct: Wood, plastic, and rubber are examples of non-magnetic materials because they are not attracted to magnets. Unlike magnetic materials like iron and nickel, these materials do not have the property of magnetism and cannot be pulled towards a magnet.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'non-magnetic'. This means these materials are not attracted to magnets. They do not have the property of magnetism that some materials like iron and cobalt have. The opposite of non-magnetic would be 'magnetic', which refers to materials that can be pulled towards a magnet.

questions.question_text: The magnetic force is strongest at the ___ of a magnet.
questions.explanation_correct: The magnetic force is strongest at the poles of a magnet because that's where the magnetic field is the strongest. The north and south poles are where the magnetic force is concentrated, so that's where magnets are the most powerful.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The magnetic force is not strongest in the middle of the magnet. The poles, or the ends of the magnet, are where the magnetic force is the strongest. The poles, which are the north and south ends, are where the magnetic field is the most concentrated and powerful.

questions.question_text: A natural magnet found in nature is called ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A natural magnet found in nature is called a lodestone. Lodestone is a type of iron ore that has natural magnetic properties. This means it can attract other magnetic materials, like iron, without any external force being applied to it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is lodestone. Lodestone is a naturally occurring magnetic mineral that can be found in the Earth's crust. It is a type of iron oxide that has strong magnetic properties. This makes it different from other non-magnetic materials like wood, plastic, or aluminum, which cannot be attracted to a magnet.

questions.question_text: A ___ uses a magnet to show direction.
questions.explanation_correct: A compass uses a magnet because magnets have a north and south pole, and they always point in the same direction. This allows the compass to show the direction you are facing, which is very useful for navigation.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer for this question is 'compass'. A compass is a device that uses a magnet to show the direction you are facing. The magnet inside the compass always points towards the Earth's north pole, allowing you to know which way is north. This is why a compass is the correct answer, not other objects that may contain magnets but do not show direction.

questions.question_text: A U-shaped magnet is also called a ___ magnet.
questions.explanation_correct: A U-shaped magnet is called a horseshoe magnet because its shape resembles a horseshoe. The U-shape allows the magnetic poles to be closer together, making the magnetic force stronger at the ends of the magnet.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A U-shaped magnet is not called a bar magnet. Bar magnets are straight, rectangular magnets. The U-shape of a horseshoe magnet allows the magnetic poles to be closer together, which is why it is called a horseshoe magnet, not a bar magnet.

questions.question_text: When freely suspended, a magnet aligns in the ___-south direction.
questions.explanation_correct: When a magnet is freely suspended, it aligns in the north-south direction because the Earth itself acts like a giant magnet. The north pole of the Earth's magnetic field attracts the south pole of the magnet, causing it to align in the north-south direction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: If the magnet aligned in any other direction, such as east-west, it would not be pointing to the Earth's north and south magnetic poles. The magnet aligns in the north-south direction because that is the direction of the Earth's magnetic field, which the magnet's poles are attracted to. The correct answer is 'north', as the north pole of the magnet will point towards the north magnetic pole of the Earth.

questions.question_text: ___ is a metal that is not attracted by magnets.
questions.explanation_correct: Copper is a non-magnetic material, which means it is not attracted by magnets. This is because copper does not contain any magnetic materials like iron or cobalt that can be magnetized.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Aluminum is also a non-magnetic material that is not attracted by magnets. However, the correct answer is copper, which is another non-magnetic metal like aluminum. Copper does not contain any magnetic materials, so it will not be pulled towards a magnet.

questions.question_text: A magnet can attract objects made of ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A magnet can attract objects made of iron because iron is a magnetic material. Magnets are able to attract other magnetic materials like iron, cobalt, and nickel, but cannot attract non-magnetic materials like wood, plastic, or aluminum.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A magnet cannot attract objects made of wood, plastic, copper, or aluminum. These are non-magnetic materials that are not attracted to magnets. The only correct answer is 'iron', because iron is a magnetic material that is strongly attracted to the magnetic force of a magnet.

ordering_items: Observe if the material is attracted
Collect the material to be tested
